For if to be a receiver even with many others is worthy (3) of disgrace, when they even reprove whilst they offer it, and withdraw themselves, how great is the reproach. For if only giving rather tardily, and with lnurrnuring, they inflame the receivers—for tell me not of impudent beggars, but of the faithful—if they were to reprove whilst they give, what would they not do? to what punishment would it not be equal? But we do not so, but as if we had been greatly injured, we so insult and turn away from those who beg of us. Thou dost not give, but why dost thou also grieve him? Admonish them, he says, as brethren, do not insult them as enemies. He who admonishes his brother, does it not publicly. Let us bestow therefore with the disposition of a brother, let us admonish with the good will of a brother, not as if we grieved at giving, but as if we grieved for his transgressing the commandment.
